data.title: Good Mexican food
data.text: Love their breakfasts.  Great flavor and good potions! The refried beans are creamy and wonderful and Machaca very tasty.

data.title: Always great...
data.text: I've been going to La Perla since I was about 12 years old and I'm 52 now, they make great food for a great price, they start with great very thin corn chips and hot sauce, not the chunky crap the chain places given, the red hot sauce which is how hot sauce should be made. The "Green Chili Burro Enchilada Style" is amazing, tender beef, soft tortilla with a to die for red sauce with cheese melted on the top....great service, old time atmosphere and they give you great food for a darn good price...

data.title: always good times
data.text: been eating here for over 15yrs great spot good food and drinks , atmosphere is on point a definite must go!!!

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Had Chili Rellenos as usual with green sauce on top.   They were so spicy hot that I could not eat them.  when asked, the waitress said you cannot determine the chili hotness before.  I can sort of buy that except you can try them before you use them.  In addition, the seeds were not removed from these chilis before cooking making them extremely hot.  I took the dinner home in a doggie bag and when I prepared them the next day they were still too hot to eat.  I threw them all in the garbage.

data.title: Still makes me smile
data.text: I moved from AZ 14 years ago, and because I'd eaten at la Perla for many years before, it was one of my last stops before moving on. I'm back at la Perla for the first time since and couldn't be happier. It's the same friendly (and friend-filled) place as I remembered, and my meal (machaca plate) was quick to the table and delicious. I hope it's as good in the next decade I'm back in town.

data.title: Horrible food, service, atmoshere
data.text: Went to listen to Mariachi's for a Birthday get together. Mariachi's started at 7 instead of 6. There were only 3 of them. The food was very bad, they charge during the Mariachi's 18%. Would not accommodate a table for 3. Charged us for 2nd round of chips and water. Food actually tasted like dog food, Never again I'll go there, that place has been there years and they don't even fix the place up looks run down. That's too bad used to be a nice place to eat and hang out.

data.title: Disappointed!!!
data.text: I am so disappointed in the food quality and service of La Perla. We have dined there before but recently, we ordered take out and it was very bad. We tried several times to contact the Manager but the times we called (during work hours and evenings), no one is available or some excuse not to speak to Manager. Our order was simple. Tacos were stale, no flavor and cold as can be. We took pics too. We will continue to call manager as we feel we should be refunded. Ended up throwing away the meals, that's how bad it was.  Not planning on returning....

data.title: This place has been around for years.
data.text: I have tried this restaurant a few times. I went back after not having been there in years hoping that maybe the food had changed and was disappointed every time.  There are so many Mexican restaurants around that there is no reason to go here and get food that doesn't taste good.

data.title: Most delicious Mexican my favorite place
data.text: I have been coming here for the past 30 years. The charm about La Perla is that no matter when I visit for breakfast lunch or dinner the food is always consistent and delicious. The red menudo is amazing I won't eat it anywhere but here. The cheese enchiladas are so smooth, silky and cheesy. I have never had a bad meal here ever. Portions are large prices are great and always recommend to friends who are looking for authentic delicious Mexican food.

data.title: Mexican food at its best!
data.text: Been there many times. Always a great experience and the food is very authentic.  If you like really good mexican food, special recipes and a true mexico environment (mariachis plus plus), then go here.  The neighborhood isn't super, but the restaurant is safe and parking is ample. Prices are very, very fair. We go as a family, but I think there is a cantina for just adults.

data.title: Wonderful restaurant
data.text:
Today I had lunch at the La Perla Cafe in Glendale, Arizona.  It was a perfectly delightful lunch.  The cafe is located west of Old Town Glendale on Glendale Avenue, and has been a family run business for 70 years.  In a small location the inside is decorated with items and personalities from the past and is very pleasant.  The service staff was friendly, helpful and always at hand for refills, etc.

The garlic shrimp dinner was quite well done.  The garlic sauce was good, but not overwhelming. Thankfully the shrimp were not overcooked.  The beans were rich and creamy.  The rice was just okay.

Overall the meal was delicious and worth the money.  

I would highly recommend this cafe for dining, including families.  The homemade tortillas are wonderful, and I brought home a dozen.

data.title: Great service, just average food
data.text:
I had some friends visiting from Milwaukee around Easter. On Easter Sunday they were craving Mexican, and I had a coupon from the Entertainment Book, so we decided to come here for dinner.

I had read good things about this place and how long they've been in business at this location. You can tell the place is old as soon as you walk in. The decor is so old that it is worn out and should be redone.

We asked for Margaritas and were told the bar was closed. Fine, it was Easter Sunday and they were not busy so maybe it was not cost effective to have the bar open.

The chips and salsa tasted of old oil and were very greasy. We ordered enchiladas and the portions were big, but the flavor was just average. We left somewhat disappointed since we've heard many good things about the restaurant. The service was very friendly and there are no complaints about that. Maybe the experience wasn't so good because of it being a very slow Sunday, but not sure I would return since I've had better Mexican elsewhere in Phoenix.

data.title: Dissappointment
data.text: This restaurant is celebrating 69yrs of buisness this year. I have gone to this restaurant for 40 plus years. Not as much as i had when i was a teenager and growing up in glendale. Their chips and salsa were great. Service was great. Atmosphere was good. The place hasnt really changed in the 40 plus years. I ordered the green chili burro and taco plate. The taco was good(but how can you go wrong on a beef taco except for the shell falling apart after the first bite). The burro was something to be desired. It had chucks of meat and green chilis, that was it. Very bland, no flavor and no spice at all to it. We met a friend there who had never been there before and she wasnt real excited about it either by the time we got done. Alot of people like this place and i use to but won't be going back again.

data.title: Old style Mexican!
data.text: Our family had gathered recently in Phoenix for the funeral of our aunt. Several of the cousins from out of town met here for dinner because this was the restaurant our aunt used to take us when we visited--58 years ago!! Not much has changed in that time. The wait staff were so friendly and the food was just as we remembered it!

data.title: Authentic Mexican food
data.text: Tortillas, salsa and food are made fresh. Nothing is frozen. Service was wonderful. A little hole in the wall with excellent food.

data.title: Real Mexican Food
data.text: My husband wanted real Mexican food served at a sit down restaurant so his aunt and cousin took us to La Perla. It was well worth the half hour drive.  The servings were a good size, the food was tasty, the decor made me feel as if I were in Mexico.  I had the enchiladas, asked if they would add onions to the cheese, no problem.  My husband had the chili rellenos and couldn't finish them. Would be willing to go back any time.

data.title: Genuine mexican food
data.text: The food here is very good and a true taste of Mexican food. Service is above average and the specials are very good. The restaurant is very old dates back in time. The ambiance is old as well. Too old worn out, the decor should be totally redone. This restaurant has been passed down through the family since the early 1900 century. Prices are very good for the food that they serve you.

data.title: Sorry...No Bueno!
data.text: If I'm not mistaken, this place was a bar or club back in the day. Well it still smells like one. The food was ok, I enjoyed the Mariachi. That's about it.

data.title: Great Mexican Food
data.text: We're from Ohio & had dinner @ LaPerla with friends who live in Glendale, Our goal was authentic Mexican cuisine in an authentic Mexican atmosphere. We had an awesome time at a reasonable price, The portions were very generous. Thankful I decided to split an entree with my husband, The staff & food is great! Looking forward to a return visit.

data.title: Very disappointed
data.text: The last 3 times we've been there have been really disappointed. 1st. Time we waited almost 45 minutes before we were given drinks, we left. 2nd.was about the so we waited this time. This last time was yesterday we were told 30-45 minutes. After 1 hour, then our order was half the order serving.  Or waitresses were slow and rude, it's a shame because we've been going there for 20 plus years, but I was born and raised in that neighborhood. I wouldn't go there again unless our meals were free.
